article_title: Energy Companies Drill for IPO Dollars
article_text:
The latest gusher among initial public offerings: shares of U.S. oil and gas drilling companies.

On Wednesday, investors lined up for an IPO by Antero Resources Corp, which operates natural-gas and oil wells in West Virginia, Ohio and Pennsylvania. The company, which is entrenched in the U.S. shale-gas boom, sold 19% more shares than planned and the deal priced above its expected range. The stock jumped in its trading debut Thursday,...

twitter.description: U.S. oil-and-gas exploration and development companies such as Antero Respources have raised $12 billion this year in IPOs and secondary offerings, according to Dealogic. That means 2013 is on track to be the biggest year since at least 1993 for such offerings by U.S. energy companies.
twitter.creator: @telisdemos

image.alt: Energy Companies Drill for IPO Dollars

twitter.title: Energy Companies Drill for IPO Dollars
